intro: Pedicularis interrupta subsp. interrupta, commonly known as the interrupted beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, often in rocky or gravelly soils. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. It is a perennial herb that is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
